subject: Re: Thanks + Next Steps with Wolf IQ

full_threads.body:
You are wonderful, thanks Joy.

I'm going to be a pain with questions initially.

When added to the list of points in Pricing - how do I match the icon colours, they seem to invert.

Secondly, regarding case studies. I would like to be able to translate the PDF Content (with updated imagery) into a landing page that's reached by clicking the learn more button from the primary case studies page, and having the PDF as a downloadable from there - does that make sense?

Warm regards
<img alt="">

Hi Katie,

We're glad to inform you that the Pricing page has been restored. See link below:
https://hosportal.kinsta.cloud/pricing/

For pages, we will need you to use "Edit in Breakdance".
Then for Posts, Case Studies, Teams, Testimonials we need to use "Edit".

Feel free to let us know if you have any further queries.

Hi Joy,

Thanks for the testimonials.
Re the pricing page I clicked on this and it's disappeared, any help/advice?

Thanks

<img alt="">

Hi Katie,

Hope your Monday’s off to a wonderful start!

Just letting you know we’ve updated the Pricing page and added the new Testimonial that's all sorted on our end.

I’ve also recorded a quick Loom video showing how you can make these updates via the WordPress Dashboard:
Watch the Loom video here.

If you’ve got any questions or need a hand with anything else, just let us know. Always happy to help!

Good morning,

I have a couple of additional testimonials to add to the website, Ideally these, along with the last ones, will be placed in front of the originals.

#1
"The HosPortal team has been an exceptional partner in streamlining our anaesthesia rostering at The Queen Elizabeth Hospital. From the initial setup to the go-live phase, they provided clear guidance, timely support, and a genuine commitment to understanding our department's needs. Their rostering platform is intuitive, adaptable, and has significantly reduced administrative workload, while allowing greater transparency and flexibility for our staff. The team's responsiveness and willingness to tailor solutions for our workflows have made a real difference in the way we manage allocations. I would highly recommend HosPortal to any department seeking an efficient, user-friendly, and well-supported rostering solution."
Dr. Thara - Head of Unit - The Queen Elizabeth Hospital


#2

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Joy T
Andy Crebar assigned to Whil Albon
Allie Borcena assigned to Daphne Bautista

full_threads.body:
Hi Katie,

Thanks for sending this through.

Looping in @Wolf IQ Support who can:
  1. Make the updates:
    • Add that pricing is for Australia and NZ customers. Global customers to contact Hosportal.
    • We need to remove the subheading "for 250+....' under the Ai section
  2. Share a loom on how to make these updates
Thanks,
Andy

On Thu, Aug 7, 2025 at 4:58 AM Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com> wrote:
Andy,

I want to make some changes to the pricing page. Can I direct this to you or is someone else in your team best?
I note it was Cindy previously.

I'd like to add that pricing is for Australia and NZ customers. Global customers to contact us.
Secondly, under the Ai section. We need to remove the subheading "for 250+....'

I also want to add some more bullets under each section
Can I have a loom on how to do this please?

Many thanks



On Thu, Aug 7, 2025 at 2:39 AM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
No problems at all.

We're here to help and standing by.

On Wed, Aug 6, 2025 at 4:39 AM Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com> wrote:
Thanks Andy,

Apologies for the delay. I will block some time to review on Friday and revert back to you.
Appreciate your patience.

Warm regards,



On Mon, Aug 4, 2025 at 1:40 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris and Katie,

Hope you both had a good weekend.

Just confirming three outstanding things.
  1. Would you like us to separate the Contact and Demo pages?
  2. Will there be an updated video for the best use page, or should we keep the current one?
  3. We created the Page Title and Meta Description sheet here for the core pages (from the existing site). Are you able to confirm accurate?
We're standing by for next steps and let us know how we can be helpful in finalizing the new site.

Thanks,
Andy

On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 11:32 AM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

Thanks for your note and for jumping in for changes, we'll review this as part of final QA (and great to hear the walkthroughs helped)

I've put where things stand as of today below.

Thanks again,
Andy

****

1. Outstanding items
  1. Would you like us to separate the Contact and Demo pages?
  2. Will there be an updated video for the best use page, or should we keep the current one?
  3. We've noted the issue you raised with the hamburger menu on mobile and will review/fix this.
2. New walkthroughs
  • Resizing Sections & Spacing in Breakdance
    ➡️ Hosportal - Editing spacing and padding - Watch Video
  • How to check mobile view, tablet view, etc
    ➡️ Hosportal - mobile and tablet impact tutorial - Watch Video
  • Return Roster Rule Global section (Re-inserting or repositioning global sections)

    Hosportal - Global blocks - Watch Video

3. Next steps
  • Once the items above are confirmed, we'll finalize page titles/meta descriptions and begin full QA (including mobile testing).

On Sun, Jul 27, 2025 at 10:12 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
Thanks

These were helpful and I've made a number of changes. I'm starting to review the mobile responsive view; the hamburger menu doesn't look right; can you have a look please?

On Fri, Jul 25, 2025 at 5:28 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

Thanks again for the detailed feedback - really helpful and will action first thing next week.

We've created a few walkthroughs for your questions below.

On the Spacing + Section Positioning, we use Breakdance which makes it easy to create and edit design (it's like a wix overlay). We're very happy to make these design changes but let us know if you'd like a walkthrough of building new pages.

Will send another update early next week.

Thanks,
Andy

****

1. Testimonials
You'll be able to add testimonials directly in the CMS.
➡️

Hosportal | Add New Testimonial - Watch Video



2. Built for Hospital Efficiency Tabs
How to update the images inside each tab.
➡️ Home - hosportal - 24 July 2025 - Watch Video

3. Updating the Swaps and Market page
➡️

Hosportal | Swaps and Market - Watch Video




**

On Thu, Jul 24, 2025 at 8:07 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
waiting on this

> On the 'Built for Hospital Efficiency' tabs, we're happy to update these images if you have them or if you prefer can share a walk through of the WordPress CMS on how to update them directly.

On Thu, Jul 24, 2025 at 10:02 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
Andy

We can add lots more testimonials. How do we do that?

> Should we add testimonials to the resources section?
how would that work

> Would you like us to add back the login button?
yes

having a lot of trouble with doing almost anything - how do you resize sections for example? how do I know the impact on different screen sizes?

Example: this page has too much space at the top:
https://hosportal.kinsta.cloud/features/swaps-and-market/

I cannot work out how to make it less

This page had a global section about AI right at the top - others have it lower own - now I've remove it don't know how to get it back and move it lower where it belongs:
https://hosportal.kinsta.cloud/features/roster-rule/

Not loving wordspace.

So hard to use.

This is why we stopped using it

Chris

On Thu, Jul 24, 2025 at 1:31 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

Thanks for your patience and feedback again.

Three things for you below on walkthroughs, testimonials and steps to finalize.

Thanks,
Andy

****

1. Walkthroughs

Here are three walkthroughs of how to complete actions. Let me know if this works for you and we'll compile the others key modules as we finalize the site.
  1. Header megamenu
  2. Footer section
  3. Adding Case Studies
2. Testimonials
On the testimonials, since there's only 6 testimonials currently we have removed the button but added functionality so when there's more than 6 testimonials, the button will show to load the entries after the initial 6.

3. Steps to finalize
As far as key items remaining:
  1. Would you like us to add back the login button?
  2. Did you want to separate the contact and demo pages?
  3. We need to finalize the page titles and meta descriptions (we can compile list once final pages confirmed)
  4. Should we add testimonials to the resources section?
  5. Will there be an updated video on best use what we have on the current site?
For final QA, we will complete performance and mobile testing as part of sign off.

Is there a target date you'd like to work towards?

On Thu, Jul 24, 2025 at 10:51 AM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Thanks Chris - we'll get that fixed and send over the walkthroughs and next steps shortly.

On Wed, Jul 23, 2025 at 10:58 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
The "see all testimonials" button is not linked up

On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 3:51 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
yes thanks

On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 3:21 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

Yes - Figma has the functionality (but photoshop works).

No problems on the CMS - Cindy will share a video walkthrough of updating CMS content later this evening.

For finalizing the rest of the website content - would you like us to collate a list of focus on the training material on how to update whats remaining?

Thanks,
Andy

On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 1:08 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
Andy

I want to know how to do these things ourselves - so prefer instructions.

We can do the screenshots using photoshop templates I think; I assumed you had them yourselves, but figma does something similar?

Thanks

Chris

On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 12:41 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

Thanks for the feedback and yes - the PSD image solution works.

If you have the screenshots, we can get our design team to recreate those images (they are just placeholders for now). Let us know if you prefer to manage and we can send you a Figma template your team can manage.

On the 'Built for Hospital Efficiency' tabs, we're happy to update these images if you have them or if you prefer can share a walk through of the WordPress CMS on how to update them directly.

Let us know what's best for you.

Thanks,
Andy


On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 7:20 AM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
On the front page we have the "tabbed" features area.

It isn't clear how we change the image shown when the tabs change. There are multiple tabs you can rename, re-order and add icons, but it is not clear how you change the content shown when the tabs are changed.

I looked for some online guidance but could not find anything useful. Are the "advanced tabs" an add-on with documentation we can review?

Thanks

Chris

On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 9:07 AM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
So now that I've had a look at WordPres - man these guys still look like they are stuck in 2002 - I see that the "tilted mobile" images are just that, images, and there's no easy way to replace what's on the screens of the mobiles.

This really isn't a workable solution for us.

I think at minimum we need some editable PSD templates that allow us to insert flat default sized mobile screenshots, that will then be rotated and surrounded by a bezel built into the PSD file.

I presume this sort of thing is pretty standard for you and you would've done just that to create the images on the site.

Can you supply us with this please, as well as instructions on exporting the images from photoshop for direct use on the website.

Thanks

Chris

On Fri, Jul 11, 2025 at 8:34 AM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
How do we fill the mobile screen images?

On Thu, Jul 10, 2025 at 3:19 PM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

Yes, you can now proceed with updating the content.

Here is the list of pages we've developed: Hosportal Sitemap.

Please let us know if there's anything we can assist you with during the content update process.

Thanks!

On Thu, Jul 10, 2025 at 1:01 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
Before we do that, we would need to update the content.

Are we at that moment?

Chris

On Thu, Jul 10, 2025 at 2:30 PM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

The All Features page has been updated, and the videos have been removed.

Please let me know if there's anything else that needs to be adjusted or updated.

Once all pages are approved, we'll be ready to push the website to your live domain.

Thanks!




On Tue, Jul 8, 2025 at 10:01 AM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Thank you for your feedback, Chris.

We'll go ahead and remove them for now.

We'll work on the suggested changes and get back to you.



On Tue, Jul 8, 2025 at 9:28 AM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
Cindy

Thanks

Getting there and looking great!

I am not sure we need the "Let AI-Powered Tools Do the Heavy Lifting" and video on every feature page. Is that something we specified Katie?

For people wanting to wander through our feature, I think it takes up to much space above the fold - once they choose a "feature" I think they want to see some stuff specific to that straight away, not after scrolling part the same segment on every feature page, so I reckon downsize that. I am not averse to a CTA about AI on each page, since its something we do want to hammer, but this takes up too much space. A way to simply nod to AI in a smaller and simpler way on each page would be better.

I also think the sliding list of feature elements is somewhat confusing and not intuitive. I suggest we remove that.

CJ

On Sun, Jul 6, 2025 at 10:55 PM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris.

Just a quick update on our progress from last week:
  • We've updated the menu based on your latest feedback. Could you please take a moment to review it and let us know if it aligns with what you had in mind?
  • We've also included additional updates below for your reference.
  • Lastly, please disregard my recent email regarding your Squarespace account - we've already successfully imported the blog posts to the staging site.
We're currently waiting for your feedback on the pages we've developed so we can proceed with final implementation and move toward completion.

Looking forward to your thoughts!

--
Here's the sitemap cross checking for easy access: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LIc-u9stMDB33n6EjVvPoCyApCAf9KstXEvjyenCPG8/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Completed pages:
  • About
  • News
  • References
  • Features
    • Roster Management
    • Swaps and Market
    • Reporting and Insights
    • Roster Rules
    • Leave Management
    • Clinical Allocations
    • Staff Messaging
We have two more remaining pages to be completed this week:
  • Customers
  • Release Notes/Help Centre


On Thu, Jul 3, 2025 at 9:22 AM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris,

We'll work on this update and let you know once it's ready for review.

In the meantime, could you please send us the credentials for your Squarespace website?

We'll need them to export all the blog posts and import them into the staging site.

Thank you!

On Wed, Jul 2, 2025 at 5:56 PM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
Thanks Cindy

It's a good improvement with the top menus, but still not quite what I had in mind.

The menus disappear altogether, then the new menu slides down.

Can we have the starting menu slide up, hit the top, then the new menu appears somehow?

Thanks

Chris

On Fri, Jun 27, 2025 at 3:51 PM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris and Terry.

We've completed all the updates from the list you provided.

In addition, the following pages have now been finalized:
  • Contact Page
  • Why Hosportal
  • Case Studies
  • Legals
The remaining pages scheduled for completion next week are:
  • Customers
  • News
  • References
  • Features
Please let us know if there are any further revisions or updates needed on the completed pages.

Looking forward to your feedback - thank you!

On Fri, Jun 27, 2025 at 12:46 PM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Terry,

Thanks so much for your feedback.

We're processed most of these items this week, Cindy will be sending another update later today.

Thanks again,
Andy

On Wed, Jun 18, 2025 at 8:08 PM Terry Li <terry@hosportal.com> wrote:
Hi Cindy,

Some feedback:

screenshot 1
The nav bar is not on top and the page scroll can be seen on over the bar.
The logo (and possible other images) needs to have a @2x for retina screen, otherwise it looks blur.
Also for the nav bar, suggest to click to show the dropdown, and click again to hide the dropdown other than hover to show/hide. Currently Resource does that, but Features does not. Suggest to make Features work like Resources.



screenshot 2
The responsiveness doesn't look right with certain screen width.




screenshot 3
When hover on the menu from the nav bar, the grey background colour doesn't look right. Maybe try make it less dark? Also the padding needs to be bigger.



Example of bigger padding


screenshot 4
The icon images are low res on mac/iphone. Suggest to use svg.



screenshot 5
These check icons can be smaller to make it more balanced and premium.


Screenshot 6, the bottom section looks unbalanced. The logo is too big and also the social media icons are too big.



Last but not the least, the current font 'Inter' doesn't look modern any more. Maybe try alternatives?
Thanks





Terry Li

Senior Software Engineer


HosPortal Pty Ltd

w. www.hosportal.com

e. terry@hosportal.com



On Wed, 18 Jun 2025 at 7:07 PM, Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Chris.

Thank you for your feedback!

We understand what you mean and will implement a sticky navigation that appears as the page scrolls.
The Pricing page is already complete, and we'll now continue with the development of the remaining pages.

We may reach out with a few questions as we go, but for now, we'll keep moving forward.

Thanks again!


On Wed, Jun 18, 2025 at 5:52 AM Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com> wrote:
Cindy

Going well.

My one comment would be I don't like how the top navigation bar continues to float, with content appearing above it.

I'd prefer the more common animation where it slides up to the top of the screen and fills the full width, with no content above/behind it; that same animation reverses when you scroll down.

I trust this makes sense?

Thanks

Chris

On Tue, Jun 17, 2025 at 4:33 PM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Katie.

Just sending over a quick update on our progress with the website development.

We've completed the Homepage and Features page, including the implementation of the mega menu.

For the Resources section of the mega menu, we weren't certain about the final content, so we've temporarily replicated the layout used in the Features menu.
Let us know what should be included there when you have a chance.

We're currently working on the Pricing page and expect to have it completed by tomorrow.

In the meantime, feel free to review the pages using the links below and share any feedback you may have. We'd be happy to make adjustments as needed.

Thank you for your patience.

--
Page links:
  • Homepage
  • Features page

Admin user:
  • URL: https://hosportal.kinsta.cloud/wp-admin/
  • Username: katie
  • Password: )7HI3j$1tiXVH^UsFb3Zp&dl

On Thu, Jun 12, 2025 at 6:55 PM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Katie.

Just a quick update - the main navigation has already been added to the website design.

You can access the updated design here, and I've also uploaded an image for quick reference.

Please let me know if you have any feedback or would like to request any revisions. Otherwise, we'll move forward with development alongside the landing page.

Thank you!

On Thu, Jun 12, 2025 at 8:42 AM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Katie.

We've scheduled the development of the landing page for this week and expect to share the completed version with you by Monday.

The remaining pages are planned for development next week, and we'll send the completed updates by the end of the week.

We've noted the placeholders to be added to the landing page for now, and we're currently working on the mega menu design based on the reference you provided.

We'll keep you posted once it's ready.

Thank you.

On Thu, Jun 12, 2025 at 7:49 AM Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com> wrote:
Thanks Cindy,

Quick question. Do you have a rough timeline for when we'll have access to the staging site?
Also, on the content side, as I mentioned before, we'll be updating this, so feel free to just drop placeholders on the pages for now.

Appreciate it

Katie



On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 12:37 PM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Katie.

Just letting you know that all CTA colors have been updated, and references to "automated" have been revised to "AI" as requested.

Please let me know if there's anything else you'd like us to update.

Thank you.

----

Copy Updates Based on Client's AI Preference:
  • Headline
    • From: Let Automation Do the Heavy Lifting
    • To: Let AI-Powered Tools Do the Heavy Lifting
  • Subheadline
    • Updated "smart conflict detection engine" to "AI-powered conflict detection engine" for clearer AI emphasis.
CTA buttons colors:
  • Homepage 2.4
  • Features Page 1.1
  • Pricing Page 1.2

On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 8:50 AM Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com> wrote:
Hey Cindy,

Appreciate that! Look forward to seeing it!

Thanks again



On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 10:45 AM Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:
Hi Katie!

Noted on the feedback - thank you for letting us know about your leave. We'll make sure to loop in Terry and Chris moving forward.

We'll work on the updates today and send you the revised version by EOD. Hopefully, we can get it approved and move into the development phase.

Thank you.

On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 8:39 AM Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com> wrote:
Andy, Cindy,

I hope you both had a lovely LWE.

I have forwarded the below comments from Chris and Terry.
On the whole, definitely moving forward in the right direction.
Key things:
CTA button (maybe a darker blue)
More content related but the word AI as opposed to automate is favourable :)

I do need to note, I am going on leave from next Thursday for 3 weeks so I'd like to get a plan in place to keep this moving forward during that time. It could be just communicating with Terry and Chris on the email and me on cc during that time.

Warm regards,



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Terry Li <terry@hosportal.com>
Date: Fri, Jun 6, 2025 at 8:41 AM
Subject: Re: Thanks + Next Steps with Wolf IQ
To: Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com>
Cc: Chris Jones <chris@hosportal.com>, Charles Lynam <charles@hosportal.com>



I agree. As you can see in those two screenshots below, the call to action button is not standing out, simply because the same blueish color is overly used and too repetitive, making it difficult to read/scan through.

Suggest to use a darker blue to make the call to action button different.






On Fri, Jun 6, 2025 at 8:24 AM Katie Funnell <katie@hosportal.com> wrote:
Updated imagery in line with feedback.
To me the blue 'button' is lost, could be solved with a darker blue. As it is our CTA it does need to stand out.

Appreciate your feedback so I can get back to Andy.
